subject: RE: [junit] getting TestRunner to see junit.samples.AllTests
msgSnippet: Try adding %JUNIT_HOME% junit to your classpath, since the samples folder is under the junit  folder. i.e.
messageBody:
Try adding %JUNIT_HOME%\junit to your classpath, since the samples folder is
under the junit folder.

i.e. CLASSPATH=.;%JUNIT_HOME%\junit;%JUNIT_HOME%\junit.jar;%JUNIT_HOME%\;
etc



Peter Spitz

>
> i have the same set up but for the trailing slash on the end of
> %JUNIT_home% that works
> it just can't be that simple, can it
>
> cvedwards2 wrote:
>
> >Hi: Just downloaded JUnit; can't wait to use it but....
> >
> >I can get TestRunner to work ( using the awtui interface ) BUT it
> >throws 'Class not found junit.samples.AllTests"' - like
> others in this
> >group.
> >
> >I realize the AllTests class isn't in the jar. And I've tried LOTS of
> >CLASSPATHS. Here my best guess - that doesn't work:
> >
> >The wndows 2k directories are
> >C:
> > J2SDK_Forte
> > junit3.7
> > junit
> > samples
> > tests
> >
> >the Win2k User Environment variables are:
> >JUNIT_HOME=C:\J2SDK_Forte\junit3.7
> >CLASSPATH=.;%JUNIT_HOME%\junit.jar;%JUNIT_HOME%\; etc
> >
> >Test Runner works but fails to find the AllTests.class which
> I can see
> >in the samples dir.
> >
> >I've spent a lot of time on this. Hope someone can point out
> my error.
> >Thanks, Clif
> >
